title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard is a project leveraging JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS to create a dynamic and interactive dashboard interface. This repository focuses on visualizing and managing data within the robofleet ecosystem, providing users with real-time insights and control over connected robotic systems. The project aims to offer a user-friendly platform for monitoring robot status, performance metrics, and task execution, ultimately streamlining robofleet operations and enhancing decision-making.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: crud-expense-tracker is a simple, yet effective, expense tracking application built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, leveraging Material-UI for a clean and responsive user interface. This project implements Create, Read, Update, and Delete (CRUD) operations to manage and visualize your expenses, making it a great learning resource and a practical tool for personal finance management. The repository serves as a demonstration of fundamental web development concepts and UI framework integration.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a modern, full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI). This project serves as a learning and development platform, showcasing best practices for structuring complex applications with React Query for efficient data fetching and management. It explores key concepts in TypeScript development and UI design, providing a solid foundation for building scalable and maintainable web applications.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, designed to manage and organize data efficiently. This project utilizes HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting to create a user-friendly web interface and automate deployment tasks. It serves as a practical example of developing a complete web application using common Python web development technologies.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository hosts a project focused on creating interactive map visualizations using HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing and back-end logic. It leverages web technologies to present geographic data in a user-friendly and informative way, exploring various techniques for dynamic map rendering and data integration. The project serves as a demonstration of web development skills applied to geospatial data visualization.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [Insert brief description of project's purpose or main feature based on README if available, e.g., "creating a real-time communication platform" or "streamlining data visualization processes"]. This repository contains the codebase for this project, demonstrating the application of modern web development practices and is tagged with the 'project' topic for easy discoverability.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern web application project built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, focusing on creating a dynamic and interactive dashboard interface. This repository showcases best practices in front-end development, demonstrating features like server-side rendering, data fetching, and UI component design, making it a useful learning resource for those exploring Next.js and dashboard development techniques.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, written primarily in TeX for professional formatting and output. It also includes a generated HTML version for easy online viewing and accessibility. This project showcases my skills in document preparation and web presentation, serving as a practical example of utilizing TeX for creating visually appealing and easily maintainable resumes.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML that aims to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This tool allows users to track their sleep patterns, calculate accumulated sleep debt, and provides insights to promote better sleep habits. As a personal project exploring TypeScript, it offers a practical application of web development principles.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript for brainstorming and organizing project ideas. This interactive board allows users to visually map out their thoughts, create connections between concepts, and manage potential project outlines, making it a useful tool for project planning and idea generation.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js (TypeScript, JavaScript) and CSS for creating and participating in online voting polls. This project showcases a practical implementation of modern web development technologies for a real-world use case, demonstrating features like secure voting mechanisms, dynamic result visualization, and user authentication (potentially, depending on the README). It's a valuable resource for developers interested in learning about full-stack development with Next.js and building interactive web applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This IoT Asset Tracking project, built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, leverages Supabase for backend functionality to provide a real-time solution for monitoring and managing assets. It utilizes modern web development practices and focuses on creating a user-friendly interface for tracking asset location and status, making it a practical application of cutting-edge technologies for IoT applications.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project showcasing a customizable and interactive event calendar built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository provides a foundation for displaying and managing events dynamically, allowing users to easily integrate a visually appealing and functional calendar into their web applications. It serves as a practical example of front-end web development using core web technologies.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains Jupyter Notebooks with Python code for various finance-related projects and analyses. It explores topics such as stock price prediction, portfolio optimization, and financial modeling, utilizing Python libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib to demonstrate practical applications of data analysis and quantitative methods in finance.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide users with insightful and engaging conversational experiences. This project showcases a modern tech stack including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, demonstrating how to integrate AI-powered functionalities into a user-friendly interface.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on [Insert short description of the project's purpose from the README or your understanding, e.g., creating an interactive globe visualization, developing a personal portfolio website, or building a data dashboard]. This repository showcases front-end development skills and explores the application of modern web technologies in a [Insert brief adjective describing the project, e.g., engaging, informative, or dynamic] manner.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing log files generated by the Robot Operating System (ROS). Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and exploring ROS log data, facilitating debugging and performance analysis within ROS-based robotic systems.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a modern e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and JavaScript, showcasing a robust and type-safe approach to online fruit sales. This project leverages Material UI (MUI) for a clean and responsive user interface, and React Query for efficient data fetching and management. It serves as a practical example of a complete e-commerce solution, demonstrating best practices for front-end development within the Next.js ecosystem, and explores relevant topics like e-commerce architecture and type-driven development.
